content.text: The following regulations shall apply in R-40:
Lot size (square feet): 40,000
Lot width (feet): 150
Lot depth (feet): 175
Front yard (feet): 50
Side yard (feet): 15
Both side yards (feet): 35
Rear yard (feet): 50
Livable floor area (square feet per dwelling unit): 850
Lot coverage (percent): 20
Building height (feet): 35
Number of stories: 2.5

The purpose of the Low-Density Residential R-40
District is to provide areas for residential development where existing
neighborhood characteristics, water supply and environmental conditions
permit full development densities of approximately one dwelling per
acre and where open space and agricultural preservation are not predominate
objectives.

In an R-40 District, no building or premises
shall be used and no building or part of a building shall be erected
or altered which is arranged, intended or designed to be used, in
whole or in part, for any uses except the following:
Permitted uses:
Same as § 280-13A of the Agricultural-Conservation District, except that wineries are excluded.[Amended 11-29-1994 by L.L. No. 26-1994]

Uses permitted by special exception of the Board of
Appeals. The following uses are permitted as a special exception by
the Board of Appeals, as hereinafter provided, and subject to site
plan approval by the Planning Board:

Same as § 280-13B of the Agricultural-Conservation District, except that a children's recreation camp, farm labor camp and veterinarian's office and animal hospital are not permitted and bed-and-breakfast uses do not require site plan approval.
Libraries, museums or art galleries.
Accessory uses, limited to the following:
Same as § 280-13C of the Agricultural-Conservation District.

No building or premises shall be used and no
building or part thereof shall be erected or altered in the Low-Density
Residential R-40 District unless the same conforms to the requirements
of the Bulk Schedule and of the Parking Schedule,[1] with the same force and effect as if such regulations
were set forth herein in full.

content.footnote:
[1]
Editor's Note: The Bulk Schedule is included at the end of this chapter, and the Parking Schedule is in § 280-78A.

content.text: Accessory buildings shall be subject to the same requirements as § 280-15 of the Agricultural-Conservation District.
For Lot Size of: 20,000- 39,999. Maximum Height: 22 feet, Minimum Setback for Side and/or Rear Yard: 20 feet
For Lot Size of: 40,000- 59,999. Maximum Height: 22 feet, Minimum Setback for Side and/or Rear Yard: 15 feet
For Lot Size of: 80,000 & over. Maximum Height: 22 feet, Minimum Setback for Side and/or Rear Yard: 25 feet
